isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built Before June 3, 2002 - ADJUSTMENTS - BLEEDING INSTRUCTIONS

svcproc.title: BLEEDING INSTRUCTIONS
svcproc.para:
The bleeder screw (Item 4, Figure 85)
is located in the upper (top) brake fluid port of caliper. It is not necessary to remove the wheel (tire and rim) to bleed the brakes.

A brake fluid distribution passage between the two pistons is cast into the caliper, allowing brake fluid to pass from piston bore to piston bore. This requires only one bleeder screw. Tighten to 7.5 to 15 ft-lbs. (10 to 20 N•m).
Check the master cylinder reservoir and fill if necessary. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the Master Service Manual for proper brake fluid.
Bleed brakes in the following order: Right Rear, Left Rear, Right Front and Left Front.
For brake bleeding procedure, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the Master Service Manual.

caution.para: All International vehicles equipped with hydraulic disc brakes are equipped with a Hydro-Max Brake Booster System. This system has two sections and each section is separate from the other. Each section uses different types of fluid. The two fluids are NOT compatible and if mixed, severe damage will occur to the contaminated component.

svcproc.para: The Hydro-Max Booster is operated by the power steering system and uses power steering fluid only.
The Braking System (Master Cylinder) uses hydraulic brake fluid only.

note.para: Contaminated brake fluid is a maintenance error and is not covered by warranty.
